posts.name: Abbas Alwishah
posts.cooked:
Hi all new user here we have an issue with 3 out of the 4 max spark communication when we plug it from the PC USB cable and connect to it using the USB Type C to program it or give it an ID it says device not recognized one out of the (1/4) once plugged in from the PC to the spark Max it see it and can view to control it but not the 3 spark max controllers can you guys please give some input or advise how to reprogram or get it to communicate ?

Thanks Michigan FC

posts.name: Emerson OHara
posts.cooked:
Please try using recovery mode:

https://docs.revrobotics.com/sparkmax/operating-modes/recovery-mode

And then flashing the latest firmware file and try again after that.

posts.name: Abbas Alwishah
posts.cooked: Thanks and I will give it a try tomorrow

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked: Make sure that you’re using version 1.4.0 of the REV Hardware Client. It got some reliability improvements that might help you here.

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked: Also, what version of Windows are you using?

posts.name: Abbas Alwishah
posts.cooked: Noah, we figured it out, you have to HOLD down the Reset bottom on the spark max whiling connecting the USB to it, don’t let go until it has fully reseted and then issues it a new ID

posts.name: dyanoshak
posts.cooked:
Glad to hear you got it working! I have a couple of clarifications:

That is the correct procedure to get into “Recovery Mode” but that has no bearing on the CAN ID, nor should that mode be necessary to update firmware except for these cases:

The firmware is corrupted by interrupting the firmware update process.

There is a driver issue preventing the client from communicating with a running SPARK MAX.

As @NoahAndrews pointed out, the latest Hardware Client version has reliability improvements that should help with what you are seeing. Please reach out to us if you continue to have update issues once all your software is up to date.
